intro: Seseli eriocephalum, commonly known as the woolly sesame, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round, hairy fruits known as schizocarps, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often growing in rocky or dry habitats. Seseli eriocephalum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
